confession.seduction_date: 18 years before (circa 1578), revised to 16 years before
confession.seduction_context: Angry about husband's infidelity with servant; had been quarrelling and calling him 'ruffien et marcot' when Percin appeared in bed promising to prevent husband's misbehavior
sabbat_activities: dancing to bombardes, haultbois et tabourins
making hail that damaged woods of La Magdelaine
opposed plan to spoil crops, proposed damaging belltower at St Dié instead

witnesses.name: Michiel Diey
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: tenant - held 'admodiation la moictresse' for her at Grattain

testimony.quarrel_subject: Marion wanted to make garden in front of house which obstructed road
Her geese were damaging his crops; he killed them after warning
Sought caution for rent owed by Marion's husband for 3 years
testimony.threat_quote: the devil should break her neck and legs

witnesses.name: Marguitte femme Demenge le Cueffre
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor - father's house was closest to hers

witnesses.name: Claudatte femme François Pelletier
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: former servant - was in service of accused 18 years before

testimony.quarrel_subject: Rumor that husband made their 'moictresse de Grattain' pregnant

witnesses.name: Jean Vaguenaire
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: was doyen to her husband when he was maire of St Dié

witnesses.name: Diey Bretaulx
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: lived for several years in house of late father, adjoining Marion's house

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: 3 years earlier, after being ill for a year

witnesses.name: Claudatte femme Claude Petit Demenge
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: first husband was Claudon la Hiere, tabellion

testimony.quarrel_subject: Marriage she agreed between her niece and one of father-in-law's sons; she gave the girl to another (Richard Didier Anthoine)

witnesses.name: Chrestienne femme François Petit Demenge
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: husband is substitut à St Dié

witnesses.name: Annon femme de noble homme Gille Padoulx
witnesses.occupation: wife of lieutenant de M. le bailli de Nancy à St Dié
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: previously married to older Claudon la Hiere

testimony.quarrel_subject: Marriage dispute with empechement declared by other suitor

witnesses.name: Jeanne veuve de Claude Henry
witnesses.occupation: widow of fernaisaire aux mines de la Croix

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: within few days of moving from Marion's house

witnesses.name: Sebille veuve Claudon Blaise
witnesses.occupation: widow of porte enseigne à St Dié

testimony.quarrel_subject: Debt which ended with witness selling her a cow for 21 francs

witnesses.name: Sebille femme Claude Barbier
witnesses.occupation: wife of bourgeois de St Dié

witnesses.name: Jean Barré
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: sister-in-law was Roson wife of Nicolas de Padoux

testimony.quarrel_subject: Husband's infidelity - invocation of devil and threats to kill herself
Wanted father to exchange sow and piglets for another sow; he refused

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: within next few days, 5 years earlier
previous year after Marion cursed her

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Confrontation with Laurence femme Colas Viney who had accused her

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Testimony of witnesses 1-7

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Testimony of witnesses 8-16

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Testimony of witnesses 17-23, interrogation of Marion

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Confrontations with witnesses; procureur asks for torture

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approves torture with moderation appropriate to age; if Laurence discharges her, only to be shown instruments

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Laurence confirms accusation once more

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Given thumbscrews and rack, but would confess nothing

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Threatened with greater torture; begged not to be tortured again. Laurence to be executed that day

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Told Laurence maintained accusation until death; Marion denied seduction; statement from Demenge Ferry that Laurence discharged all except Marion and Demenge Milan

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Additional depositions from witnesses 24-30

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Additional depositions from witnesses 28-32

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Confronted with Libaire femme Guillaume Bouchier who maintained charges of seeing her at sabbat

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Denied charges about whipped girl and healing remedy to Mengeatte

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Confronted with additional witnesses; procureur asks for question ordinaire et extraordinaire

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Change de Nancy says insufficient fresh evidence for renewed torture; she should be renvoyée

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Confronted with Libaire again; court invoked opinions from judicial experts; was racked and confessed

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Admitted more animal killings; discussed seduction details

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Repeated confessions; asked to be executed by Tuesday; procureur asks for death sentence

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Change de Nancy suggests confession appears made under fear; death only approved after reiteration without threat

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Further repetition of confessions

timeline.subject: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
timeline.details: Sentence carried out

torture.restrictions: moderation appropriate to her age; if Laurence discharges her, only to be shown instruments

accomplices_named.name: widow of Michiel de la Haute Rue
Laurence of le Faing
accomplices_named.context: Recognized at sabbat; was the accuser who named Marion

accomplices_named.name: Libaire femme Guillaume Bouchier
accomplices_named.context: Recognized at sabbat; accused Marion of being there

accomplices_named.name: Demenge Milan
accomplices_named.context: Not discharged by Laurence at execution

prior_accusations.context: Accused Marion at sabbat; maintained accusation until execution
15-16 years earlier, servant to Marion, accused by executed witch; was whipped; called out Marion caused her ruin and took her first time to sabbat
Said during her trial that Marion's husband persuaded her to go to sabat saying Marion went

notable_quotes.speaker: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
notable_quotes.french: qu'il y en a desja eues des bruslées au vieu Marché qui estoient plus proches que la detenue et ne l'ont poinct accusée et que sy elle a esté soubconnée par quelque personne qu'elle le dise et que beaucoup de personnes se peuvent ressembler
notable_quotes.context: Defense during confrontation - there have already been burned witches closer to her who didn't accuse her; many people can resemble each other

notable_quotes.speaker: Laurence femme Colas Viney
notable_quotes.french: que lors qu'elle aura sentie les tourmens de la question elle changera bien de propos
notable_quotes.context: When she feels the torments of torture she will change her words

notable_quotes.speaker: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
notable_quotes.french: elle a esté continuellement en prieres envers dieu, de l'illuminer par son St Esprit a ce que sy elle avoit esté quelque fois tentée et abusée par l'ennemy et faict quelque chose mal a propos elle s'en puisse resouvenir pour en faire la confession
notable_quotes.context: In prison, praying to God to illuminate her if she had been tempted by the enemy

notable_quotes.speaker: Young servant girl being whipped
notable_quotes.french: Ho que le diable soit la meschante genoxe, elle est cause de ma ruyne, elle m'a mené la premiere fois la ou que je suis esté
notable_quotes.context: Calling out as she passed Marion's house - Marion is cause of her ruin, took her the first time to where she went

notable_quotes.speaker: Marion veuve Demenge le Masson
notable_quotes.french: que les pauvres vieilles gens, comme elle, n'osoient plus enseigner de remede a raison que quand elles enseignoient quelque remede pour guerir quelque maladie l'on disoit incontinent que s'estoient des mauvaises gens
notable_quotes.context: Poor old people like her dared not teach remedies anymore because when they taught cure for illness, people immediately said they were bad people

relationships.evidence_text: maire Jean de Sarrux, ses nepveux
Sister Margueritte was Demenge le Cueffre's wife
daughter Roson had married Nicolas de Padoux
whose wife Roson was his sister-in-law
First husband had been Claudon la Hiere, tabellion

relationships.person1: Annon femme de noble homme Gille Padoulx
relationships.evidence_text: Had previously been married to older Claudon la Hiere
He held 'admodiation la moictresse' for her at Grattain
was doyen to her husband when he was maire of St Dié

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Marion wanted to make garden in front of house which obstructed road
Her geese damaging crops; he killed them
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after warning and killing geese 16 years before

harms_catalog.harm_description: Great pain in thigh and leg around midnight; unable to walk for a year, then needed crutches; place on thigh white and trembled constantly
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Sought caution for rent owed by Marion's husband for 3 years
harms_catalog.method_alleged: curse - 'devil should break her neck and legs'

harms_catalog.harm_description: Great pain throughout body, ran up and down like incensée et enragée, swollen as if pregnant; stomach full of animals giving no rest except when drinking cold milk; forced to eat/drink at all hours; spat black infected matter every morning; animals seen running in body when in bed
harms_catalog.method_alleged: soup made with herbs with black grains like coal at bottom

harms_catalog.harm_description: Died suddenly on Sunday, day before marriage was to be solemnized
Sick for 3 weeks, unable to eat, then suddenly recovered
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Refused to do carting for her

harms_catalog.victim_name: Horse of late husband of Jennon veuve Demenge Bretaux
harms_catalog.harm_description: Died after being ill for a year
Went out late to pee, came back saying hot air passed in front of face, died as soon as he got into bed
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Great quarrel over marriage she agreed between her niece and his son; she gave girl to another (Richard Didier Anthoine); case went to cour de Rome

harms_catalog.harm_description: Became very strangely ill within few days of moving from Marion's house; threw himself on tables and benches with feet against wall; felt something in body giving no rest; died after 8 weeks claiming it was her witchcraft
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: within few days of moving from Marion's house

harms_catalog.harm_description: Felt as if punched in stomach, then suffocating; apothecaries couldn't help, said it was witchcraft; recovered after making soup with bread, salt, ashes from Marion's house
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Quarrel over debt which ended with witness selling her a cow for 21 francs

harms_catalog.victim_name: 3 of 4 calves of Jean Gaixatte le vieux
harms_catalog.harm_description: 3 of 4 fine calves in stable died within next few days
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Wanted father to exchange sow and piglets for another sow; he refused; she went to house when he was absent and asked to see them
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: within next few days, 5 years earlier

harms_catalog.harm_description: Fell twice from loft, dislocated rib, abscess on knee; had to use crutch for a month; recovered after Marion gave 6 deniers to buy apothecary remedy
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Marion cursing her because she owed 9 francs rent

harms_catalog.harm_description: Died in prison after eating 'millet' (or rice) cooked in kitchen of maire Jean de Sarrux (Marion's nephew)
harms_catalog.method_alleged: something put in food from cornet of paper by Jean's father

material_culture.context: Given to Marguitte femme Demenge le Cueffre with black grains like coal at bottom
Given by devil Percin; tested on hen which died; used to kill cows
Marion said when she heard thunder she rushed to blessed candle and her hours (prayer book)
Prayer book Marion said she used during thunderstorms
Obtained from Marion's house to make healing soup for Sebille
Put over door as test; Marion unable to mount stairs three times
Used by Alison veuve Colas Robinet and Mengeatte femme Mongeon Gille after injuries
Marion gave to Mengeatte to buy apothecary remedy
Price Sebille paid Marion for cow
Rent owed by Mengeatte to Marion
Amount Marion threatened to spend to make witness prove accusations
Cooked for Barbelline in prison in maire's kitchen; allegedly poisoned
Contained substance allegedly put in Barbelline's food

spatial_references.context: Primary location of trial and Marion's residence
Where Marion held property and had tenant; location of several witnesses
Sabbat location where Marion confessed to being carried by wind
Another sabbat location mentioned by Libaire
Only area damaged by hail made at sabbat
Location of several witnesses and l'hospitalliere
Location of witness Marguitte femme Jean le Rouet
Location of maire Claude le Clerc
Origin of young servant girl accused by executed witch; Marion's destination she was happy to make after Jacotte didn't confess
Where niece of accused (who witnessed devil invocation) was married
Location of surgeon consulted by Alison veuve Colas Robinet
Where Claude Henry worked as fernaisaire
Marion confessed proposing to damage this instead of crops
Origin of Laurence who accused Marion

prior_legal_disputes.description: Marion threatened to sue Marguitte femme Demenge le Cueffre for accusing her of causing illness; would cost 100 francs to make her prove it
Case between Marion and Claudon la Hiere over marriage agreement went to cour de Rome

legal_context.redress_outcome: Witness forced to beg mercy under threats and persuasion

change_de_nancy.modification_details: First torture approved with moderation for age; if Laurence discharges, only show instruments. Second torture request rejected as insufficient fresh evidence; should be renvoyée. Third torture approved after expert opinions; death approved only after confession reiterated without threat

hearsay_chains.source: niece of accused (now married at Raon)
hearsay_chains.content: Marion continued calling on devil during evening; around midnight something tried 3 times to lift her from bed; husband said he could see she was witch
Marion crying out 'Jesus Maria, il y a quelque chose qui m'en veult emporter'

hearsay_chains.source: mother-in-law, wife of François Petit Demenge
hearsay_chains.content: Maid told how Barbelline died in prison after eating millet; Marion cleaned pot 6-7 times
Jean's father put something in rice pot from cornet of paper
Had seen Marion talking to herself with animal like grillot; heard them talking to one another

emotional_state_notes: crying and fearful when rumor of arrest
begged not to be tortured again
asked to be executed by Tuesday after confession

third_parties.name: Demenge le Masson
third_parties.context: Married 38 years; was maire of St Dié; had affairs including with moictresse de Grattain

third_parties.name: Jacquatte Hault Rue
third_parties.context: Being tried shortly before Marion's arrest; Marion expected to be arrested after her

third_parties.name: Diey Bazelaire
third_parties.context: Apparently a surgeon consulted by Alison veuve Colas Robinet

third_parties.name: Surgeon of Houville
third_parties.context: Consulted by Alison; told her she was bewitched

third_parties.name: Lienard le Papellier
third_parties.context: Husband of witness Barbeline; wife came with Marion to pressure Marguitte

third_parties.name: Richard Didier Anthoine
third_parties.context: Marion gave her niece to him in marriage instead of to Claudon la Hiere's son

third_parties.name: Barbelline (prisoner)
third_parties.context: Died in prison 3 years before; allegedly after eating poisoned food from Jean de Sarrux's kitchen; seen at sabbat

third_parties.name: Bastien Stablo
third_parties.context: Endured torture and was renvoyé when Marion's husband was maire

third_parties.name: One named Dion
third_parties.context: Endured torture and was renvoyé when Marion's husband was maire

third_parties.name: la doyeneresse of Mazellay
third_parties.context: Endured torture and was renvoyé when Marion's husband was maire

third_parties.name: Young girl from Moyenmoustier
third_parties.context: Servant to Marion 15-16 years earlier; accused by executed witch; whipped; blamed Marion for her ruin

third_parties.name: Jacotte fille Michiel Demenge Anthoine
third_parties.context: From le Vieux Marché; arrested recently; Marion relieved when she hadn't confessed

third_parties.name: Pierron Malland
third_parties.context: Marion claimed he could verify she was at house in Grattain on day Laurence claimed to see her at sabbat

third_parties.name: Roson
third_parties.relationship_to_witness: daughter of witness 20; wife of Nicolas de Padoux
third_parties.context: Lived in Marion's house first year of marriage; husband became ill and died after moving

third_parties.name: Moictresse de Grattain
third_parties.context: Woman Marion's husband allegedly made pregnant 18 years before

third_parties.name: Niece of Marion (married at Raon)
third_parties.context: Witnessed Marion calling on devil after quarrel with husband

third_parties.name: Niece contracted to marry Gerard Ladouic
third_parties.context: Died suddenly day before marriage 17 years earlier

extraction_metadata.notes: Trial shows clear resistance to torture initially, confession only under second torture session. Change de Nancy showed caution, requiring reiteration without threat before approving death. Strong evidence of reputation (30 years mentioned by one witness), multiple harms alleged across animal deaths, human illness and death. Marion demonstrated knowledge of healing (gave remedy to Mengeatte). Notable that her husband had been maire, giving her social standing. Economic status assessed as middling based on: property ownership in Grattain with tenant, ability to threaten spending 100 francs on lawsuit, selling cow for 21 francs, but also debt disputes.
